dialogue.raw_text: Don't you guys communicate over there?  You must be the same way we are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was a report about Lisa Henderson -- January, 1977 -- the file's not here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean it's not here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: San Francisco P.D. Detective Nilsen. Internal Affairs.  You know him? Tell him we want it back.  He's had it a whole year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He and Gus sit there -- they look tired, upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gus thinks about it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So Nilsen had a report on her -- so what.  You don't know what the hell was in it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Catherine told me what was in it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If she's telling  you the truth.

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you get it, Gus?  If Beth killed Johnny Boz to frame Catherine -- she wouldn't want anyone to know what happened at Berkeley.  It gives her the motive to kill Nilsen.

dialogue.raw_text: How did she know Nilsen knew about it -- if it happened?

dialogue.raw_text: He was I.A.  He probably asked her about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'd have to be nuttier than a twenty-pound Christmas fruitcake. She's not the one who hangs out with multiple murderers -- your girlfriend is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's a writer -- it's part of what she does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (irate) Goddamn writers -- all they do is use up trees and ruin people's eyes. (a beat) There's gotta be somebody at Berkeley who knows what the hell happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know what happened.  Catherine told me what happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat, quietly) You got goddamn tweety-birds flutterin' around your head, that's what you got.  You think you're gonna fuck like minks, raise rugrats, and live happily ever after?  Oh, man.

direction.raw_text: She pulls him close.

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you get in here?

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't not see me long enough to miss me.

dialogue.raw_text: Did you miss me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come over here and tell me no.

dialogue.raw_text: No.

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet it isn't.

dialogue.raw_text: But we're getting there.

dialogue.raw_text: He died -- about five or six years ago.

dialogue.raw_text: He was walking home from work. They only lived a coupla blocks from the clinic.  Somebody drove by and shot him.

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) Was his wife ever a suspect?

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) I had another one of you guys down here from Frisco -- about a year ago -- he asked me the same question.  What's this about anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Routine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he said it was routine too. Now it's two guys saying it's routine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you remember his name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a long beat) Nope, can't say that I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nilsen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope. (a beat) There was some talk; it never panned.

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of talk?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The usual -- a girlfriend.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope. She did. (a beat) Like I say.  It never panned.

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat, gets up) Thanks.

dialogue.raw_text: I hope I helped you out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) You did.

direction.raw_text: He walks around the house; he sees her sitting out on the deck, a portable word-processor in front of her.  She is smoking. He goes up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves toward her.  She moves away, kills her cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other a long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at her.  A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at her.  He can't believe what she is saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks -- Hazel Dobkins is there. Catherine still has her eyes on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat, and then she turns to go inside.  Hazel Dobkins smiles slowly at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Hi.  I missed you.  I finished my research.

dialogue.raw_text: I finished my book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did it end?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) I told you.  She kills him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Goodbye, Nick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I finished my book. (a beat) Didn't you hear me?* (a beat) Your character's dead. (a beat) Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want, Nick?  Flowers? I'll send you some flowers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) What is this -- some kind of... Joke? (a beat; he almost smiles) Are we playing games again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) The games are over.  You were right. It was the fuck of the century, Shooter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Catherine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He sits in his Porsche, staring ahead.  He is parked next to Gus' Cadillac.  Gus is suddenly there, onway to his car.

direction.raw_text: Nick just stares ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Catherine Tramell's roommate her freshman year.  I got a call from her.  I've been calling people who were in her dorm all day.  She must've heard I was trying to talk to her.  She says she knows all about Catherine and Lisa Henderson. She's over in Oakland.  You wanna come with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like you seen a ghost, son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gus drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick doesn't even respond.  Gus looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick doesn't say anything, stares ahead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) Johnny Boz's psychiatrist has an office on Van Ness.  Guess who he shares office space with?  Dr. Elizabeth Gardner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in hell's the matter with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gus gets out with Nick.  It is an old building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat, and Nick gets back in the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell you goin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) I'm going with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She said alone -- suite 405.  It ain't gonna take long.

direction.raw_text: Gus is on the first floor.  There is no one around.  He hits the elevator button.  A beat, and it comes.  He steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits the button for the fourth floor. The elevator rises a floor, stops.  The door opens.  There is no one there.  Then it starts going up again.  It rises to the third floor.  It stops.  The door opens.  There is no one there. Then it starts to rise again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick sits there, staring ahead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly, screaming) Gus!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As it goes up.  It stops.  The door starts to open.  As it does -- a figure in a hooded raincoat sweeps into the elevator. It happens very fast.  We see blonde hair around the face. But we don't see the face itself -- the head is down, the hood up.  There is an icepick in the figure's hand.  The figure explodes into Gus.  The icepick goes into his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick tears desperately up the stairway -- he hits the fourth floor door.  It explodes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands there a beat, sees the elevator door open.  He runs there,  He sees Gus, crumpled into the corner of the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes into the elevator -- holds Gus.  He is dead.  A long beat.  He sees the gun in Gus' hand -- he takes the gun out of his hand.  He runs out of the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hears something.  Gun in hand, he runs towards the SOUND. He stops, gun in hand, listens again.  He runs again, hears nothing. Behind him, we see a figure. He spins suddenly, gun, in hand.  Beth Gardner is there. She wears a windbreaker.  She has her hands in the pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles a strange smile.  She takes a step toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles strangely again, takes a step toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves a hand in a pocket and moves towards him fast -- BETH What is wrong with you? And he FIRES the gun.  She is hit in the chest, goes down. A long beat, and then he goes to her.  He gets down on the ground.  Her eyes are open.  He empties the pockets of the windbreaker -- first one, then the other the pockets are empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she dies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Put your hands up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) Put your fucking hands up!  Don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a message on my machine to meet Gus here.  Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) Don't! (a beat) I know about your husband.  You still like girls, Beth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) Take your hands out of your pockets!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a whisper) I loved you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant.

It has a thin steel handle and is bloody.  He hands the icepick to an assistant. He looks at the raincoat.  It has blood on it.

dialogue.raw_text: It's departmental issue.

dialogue.raw_text: . WALKER (quietly) Jesus.

direction.raw_text: Bottom drawer, bureau in the bedroom.

We see a copy of Love hurts, Catherine's paperback book, and a stack of photos of Catherine. Walker picks the photos up, goes through them -- we see shots of Catherine in college -- Catherine at a fight --Catherine with Johnny Boz -- Catherine with Roxy. He hands the photos to Nick. Nick stares at them.

dialogue.raw_text: . WALKER She must've heard you on the stairway and dumped the stuff.

direction.raw_text: comes over to them.

direction.raw_text: A long beat.

direction.raw_text: He and Nick look at each other a beat.

direction.raw_text: Nick looks at him, expressionless.

dialogue.raw_text: There was no suite 405 in that building.  Catherine Tramell's roommate in her freshman year is dead.  She died of leukemia two years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our files on Dr. Gardner show nothing about a police report in Berkeley -- nothing related to Salinas, either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ballistics says the .38 we found in her apartment matches Nilsen. No registration.  They're checking with Salinas.  The icepick is the same brand and model as the Boz weapon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We checked the tape machines at Dr.  Gardner's apartment and at her office -- both here and the one on Van Ness.  No message from Gus on any of 'em.  The one at her apartment was broken. (a beat) Johnny Boz's psychiatrist says he thinks he remembers Dr. Gardner and Boz meeting at a Christmas party at his house a year ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . WALKER (after a long beat, sadly) You just can't tell about people, can you.  Even the ones you think you know inside-out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Congratulations, Curran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He parks his car.  It is dark.  Foggy. He starts heading inside.

direction.raw_text: He goes in.  He starts to walk up the dark stairway, we see him walking up several flights of steps.

direction.raw_text: He opens his door with his key.

direction.raw_text: He walks in.  The apartment is dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a whisper, almost a hiss.  He spins, fast.  Catherine stands there, pressing herself against a wall.  They look at each other a long beat.  She looks like she is almost in a trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her, expressionless.  A long beat, their eyes are into each other.  She looks like she is almost shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks very emotional.  He moves towards her, puts his arms around her, holds her very close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He presses her closer and closer to himself, holds her.

dialogue.raw_text: (behind him) Hi.

dialogue.raw_text: I heard about it... on TV.

dialogue.raw_text: I can't allow myself to care about you -- I can't allow myself to care -- I can't -- I can't --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a whisper) I don't want to do this -- please -- I don't want to do this -- I lose everybody -- I don't want to lose you -- I don't want to --

direction.raw_text: It is dark; we can't see clearly. Atop her... he makes love to her... gently... tenderly... hardly moving inside her... there are tears in her eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Atop him... she is on her knees, straddling him... he is on his back, his eyes are closed... her head arches back...  her breasts high... he strains toward her with his body...  she holds her arms high... her right hand is in a fist... (we only see the back of her hand and arm)... it comes down suddenly... he bucks... writhes... then her whole body falls on top of him. A very long beat... We can't see him... her body completely covers him... And then finally he moves... turns her to the side...  kisses her.
